div.l: And paied for the soper eueridell
Of Iohn and of Aleyn̄ / that betyn hym wele
His wyf is swifed and his doughter als
Lo soche it is for a meller to be fals
And therfor this proverbe / is said full sothe
Hym thar not wene well that yuell dothe
A gilour shall hym self be giled be
And god that sittyth / hye in mageste
Save alle this company / gret and smale
Thus have I quitte / the myller in my tale
Here endithe the tale of the Reve þᵗat he tolde be þᵉ Meller
And here begynneth the Prolog of the Cookes tale
THe cook of london whil þᵉ Reve spak
For ioye hym thought / he clawed on þᵉ bak
Ha A qduod he / for cristis passion̄
This myller hath a sharpe conclusion̄
Vpon̄ his Argument / of herbigage
Well seid salamon̄ / in his language
Ne bring not euery man / in to thyn house
For herberwyng / be night is perilouse
Well oughte a man̄ avised for to be
Whom that he brought vnto his priuite
I pray to god so yeve me sorowe and care
Yf ever sithen I hight hogge of ware
Herd I meller better I sett a werke

div.note: The scribe's obvious confusion can be reconstructed as follows: the exemplar, like that for most gamma witnesses, reversed lines 16 and 15, but the scribe also omitted 15 after copying 16; he copied 17-20 before recognizing the error and then copied 15 after 20, marking line 16 with marginal "a" and 15 with marginal "b"; for some reason—perhaps the subpuncted memorial contamination "of malice" in 19—he decided to recopy lines 19-20 on 72r, and therefore bracketed them on 71v to indicate deletion.
